intro: Ecbolium striatum, commonly known as the striped ecbolium, is a member of the Malvaceae family. It is a herbaceous perennial plant characterized by its striking, striated leaves that feature prominent longitudinal veins. The plant produces small, pale yellow flowers with five petals, typically arranged in clusters. Native to tropical and subtropical regions, it thrives in humid, well-drained soils. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens and greenhouses.
